article.headline: VA Commonwealth 69, Elon University 49
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Jesse Pellot-Rosa led a balanced attack with 13 points as Virginia Commonwealth pulled away to defeat Elon 69-49 Wednesday night. The Rams (2-1) took an early lead, but the Phoenix tied the game at 12 with 7:43 remaining in the first half. The Rams went on a 7-0 run, and the Phoenix (1-4) missed 4-of-5 field goal attempts and had seven turnovers before the break. Leading 27-20 at the half, the Rams hit their first four field goal attempts of the second half, three 3-pointers, taking a 40-21 lead with 16:01 left. The Phoenix could get no closer than 15 the rest of the way. B.A. Walker added 11 points for the Rams, who had eight players with five or more points. Rasmi Gambel led the Phoenix with 12 points. Scottie Rice and Jackson Atoyedi added 10 apiece. Atoyedi contributed 10 rebounds, helping Elon to a 37-35 edge on the boards. However, the Phoenix had 23 turnovers, 15 of which resulted in steals for the Rams.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
